comments:
build i0505-1045

- I have all of Core checked out from HEAD
- I closed runtime and resources (and did stuff, then re-opened)
- later on I noticed the following exception in my console

CVSTeamProvider#isWatchEditEnabled() needs to check if the project is accessible
before trying to access the persistent properties

Note that there are 3 exceptions below. #1 and #3 are the same. Is #2 related?

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 372 May 05, 2004 15:40:37.435

I just got this again (both exceptions). 

- all of Core loaded from HEAD
- in the Navigator multi-select runtime and resources
- context menu -> Close
- get the 2 exceptions

One interesting thing to note is that the decoration is still on one project but
not the other. (presumably because of the exception)

I already fixed this case for non-existant projects so it will be easy to add 
the opened check

IResource#isAccessible will handle both cases for you. For a resource it makes
sure it exists. For a project it makes sure it exists and is open.
Fix to use isAccessible() released to HEAD.
